title: My website is inaccessible
content:
I own a website (chendersceramics.com) that I created several years ago and have always been able to visit without a problem. Today I got the message Secure Connection Failed and the site won't open. The error is Error code: SSL_ERROR_NO_CYPHER_OVERLAP. I haven't done anything to change the website recently, so why is this happening and how can it be fixed?

Thanks, Carol

title: Weird Firefox behaviour
content:
Trivial example of "weird" behaviour:

I have an Adobe Reader window open and a Google Chrome window open on my screen. I click on Firefox to open another window and both the Adobe and the Chrome windows are removed from my screen. No tiling. Just moved away. I can get the Adobe and/or Chrome window back, but then Firefox "disappears." This makes Firefox unusable for me. I have NOT changed any of my Firefox settings in probably years. Help please.
creator: katiedoes

title: Add-ons
content: Can I change the directory where Firefox stores the add-on xpi files? Our company's IT dept is constantly deleting or corrupting them. Right now it's: C:\Users\User\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\riqfpq8g.default-release\extensions If I could just add a folder and tell firefox where the files are, this might solve that problem. Any ideas?
